Authors:
Timothy J. Baroni, Claudio Angelini, Sarah E. Bergemann, D.
Jean Lodge, Lance Lacey, Tracy A. Curtis, Sharon A. Cantrell
Title:
Rhodocybe/Clitopilus clade (Entolomataceae, Basidiomycota) in
the Dominican Republic: four new species, one new variety and three
first reports for Hispaniola
Keywords:
Clitocella, atp6, rpb2, tef1, phylogenetics, termite
nests
Abstract:
The information presented here is a result of over 20
years of field work on macrofungal biodiversity in the Dominican
Republic by two different research teams. Based on morphological and
phylogenetic investigations, four new species in three different genera,
Clitocella, Clitopilus and Rhodocybe, one new variety of a Rhodocybe
previously known only from other islands in the Caribbean, and first
reports of Clitopilus prunulus, Rhodocybe mellea and R. roseiavellanea
are described and illustrated from the island of Hispaniola. Three
protein coding genes, rpb2, tef1, and atp6, were used to compare taxa
and make phylogenetic inferences about novel species and varieties. This
contribution is a first step in documenting the macrofungal biodiversity
of the Entolomataceae for the Dominican Republic and the island of
Hispaniola.
